roleset.name: cause or point out a difference

example.name: differentiate between
example.text: Certainly [conservative environmentalists]-1 can defend their limited government position by [*-1] differentiating between Old Environmentalism and New Environmentalism (``Journalists and Others for Saving the Planet,'' by David Brooks, editorial page, Oct. 5).
example.arg: between Old Environmentalism and New Environmentalism

example.name: arg1 unstated
example.text: Producers-2 also are trying [*-2] to differentiate by concentrating on higher-profit output, such as coated and electrogalvanized products, which remain beyond the reach of minimills.
example.arg: by concentrating on higher-profit output, such as coated and electrogalvanized products, which remain beyond the reach of minimills
example.note: Arg1 here defaults to 'among themselves' or something like that.

roleset.name: discern or mark a difference

role.descr: Second thing differentiated (if a separate argument from first thing)

example.name: All args
example.text: The doctor differentiated chicken pox from the common cold using the patient's red spots.

example.name: No agentive role
example.text: Red spots differentiate chicken pox from the common cold.

roleset.note: Based on medical QA corpus-- it isn't very different from frame .01, but avoids issues with concatenation (Framed by Anwen 07/19/10)

predicate.note: Frames file for 'differentiate' based on sentences in wsj. No access to verbnet at the moment.
